bibl.title: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to Auguste A. Nouel, July 24, 1900

div1.p: Stark reprimands Nouel for failing to properly handle a yellow fever outbreak at Pinar del Rio.

div1.head: Letter from Alexander N. Stark to Auguste A. Nouel, July 24, 1900
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. J. R. KEAN
L.S. 205, Military File, 1900.
CHIEF SURGEON'S OFFICE,
Hdqrs. Dept. Havana & Pinar del Rio
QUEMADOS, CUBA.
July 24th, 1900.
Act. Asst. Surgeon Auguste A. Nouel, U.S.A.,
Pinar del Rio Barracks, Cuba.
(Thro' Military Channels) Sir:-
div1.p:
Being temporarily in charge of the Chief Surgeon's Office,
I shall simply reprimand you for the course you have pursued in the
face of an epidemic of Yellow Fever that should have been apparent, and
shall have the Surgeon General deal with your case on its merits.

I find it impossible to comprehend the dense stupidity that has
actuated your course when the well known pathological lesions of yellow
fever were presented to you in addition to the perfect clinical picture

Nothing but the hand of Providence has saved the garrison of
Pinar del Rio Barracks, from an awful fate.

You have persuaded the Surgeon General and the Chief Surgeon of
the Division that years of experience in the Tropics have made you
familiar with diseases endemic in such regions, and in the face of that
assurance have conducted yourself in a very reprehensible manner.
You will accompany the First Infantry to New York at which point you
will hear from the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
A. N. Stark,
Captain & Asst. Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Acting Chief Surgeon.
